content: l s made in lea s leftover checkered scrunchie in this pattern i will guide you through how to make a hair scrunchie by calculating the necessary number of sts after making a swatch with any dk/fingering/lace weight leftover yarn that you might have materials i used sierra andina by adriafil i used 9-10g/24- 27m of the mc white 7-8g 19-22m of the cc red you can use any yarn i do not advise a heavier weight than dk circular needles in the size that matches your yarn for magic loop i used 4mm needles step 1 knit a small swatch in the colourwork pattern described below here you mainly need the sts per cm mine was 27sts x 29rows = 10cm x 10cm step 2 measure the circumference of the hair elastic that you are planning to use mine was 14 cm step 3 make a small calculation you should cast on the number of sts that corresponds to 2 5-3 times the circumference of your elastic i calculated 2 5 x 14cm = 35cm then divide the swatch sts 27 sts in my case by the cm of the swatch 10cm in my case so 27sts 10cm = 2 7 take this number and multiply it by your final measurement 2 7 x 35cm = 94 5 now round it up to a number that is divisible per 4 for the colourwork pattern i chose 92 sts cast on 92 sts or the number of sts you have calculated with mc join the work in the round place m for bor now with magic loop or your preferred method you will work in the pattern described below colourwork pattern repeat row 1 *k3 with mc k1 with cc* repeat *to* until the end of the round row 2 *k3 with mc k1 with cc* repeat *to* until the end of the round row 3 *k3 with mc k1 with cc* repeat *to* until the end of the round row 4 k all with cc continue repeating row 1-4 until the work measures 8-9cm or the desired width end on a row 3 bind off all sts loosely with mc cut the cc yarn leaving a tail 4 times as long as the circumference of your work cut the mc yarn and hide the tails now you will sew the seams of the scrunchie together as shown and described below continue repeating the steps until you have sewn the entire seams together you could wash and block your work before sewing the seams together but it s not absolutely necessary madeinlea s ã copyright 2025 1 turn the work inside 2 fold the scrunchie in two 3 align the cc lines then w ith out and wrap the hair elastic around the elastic a tapestry needle go through both legs of the first cc st fr om around it right
